element.name: Europe's First by Chris O'Byrne, Traditional Cache (1/3)
element.long-description:
Bray Head, County Wicklow, Ireland.
The first geocache in Europe, placed on 3rd June 2000 - just one month after the demise of selective availability.
When selective availability was turned off, and the geocaching game took off, I decided to hide a cache near where I was living in Bray, Co. Wicklow. I was delighted to see that I manged to place the cache before anyone else in Europe placed one.
And so all was well, until 15 June 2003, when I went to visit the cache and found it to be gone! Disheartened, I found it too difficult to replace the cache.
Enter Donnacha who, on 31 May 2004, placed a replacement cache within eyeshot of the original location. The coordinates listed above refer to the coordinates of the replacement cache - the original cache was at 53d 11.477' N, 6d 04.804' W, hidden under stones where the two walls meet. You can view photos here and here. If you are visiting the replacement, do say hello to the original location!
And so the cache lives again! Enjoy!
Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
element.encoded-hints: Under the big white rock, covered by some stones and dead heather.

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Evetke
First in Ireland, first for Monica.

2010-06-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by Trüffelschwein1506
# 38 of 38 on our tour through Ireland
Greetings from Austria!
The last will be the first... lol Our last cache on our tour... wow! the first in Europe...
TFTC!
Trüffelschwein1506

2010-05-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by Hottie&Scottie
Found while on vacation from Canada. Dropped off some coins from Canada's First Geocache.

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2432
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
A mandatory cache for anyone visiting Ireland. [:D] It was a pretty nice start for the European geocaching i must say. We enjoyed the walk and the beautiful views.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2009-07-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Out for a day of caching with JME1979 - this was our eighth find for the day and my 305th overall.

wpt.name: GC43
wpt.desc: Europe's First by Chris O'Byrne, Traditional Cache (1/3)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Europe's First
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Bray Head, County Wicklow, Ireland.

The first geocache in Europe, placed on 3rd June 2000 - just one month after the demise of selective availability.

When selective availability was turned off, and the geocaching game took off, I decided to hide a cache near where I was living in Bray, Co. Wicklow. I was delighted to see that I manged to place the cache before anyone else in Europe placed one.

And so all was well, until 15 June 2003, when I went to visit the cache and found it to be gone! Disheartened, I found it too difficult to replace the cache.

Enter Donnacha who, on 31 May 2004, placed a replacement cache within eyeshot of the original location. The coordinates listed above refer to the coordinates of the replacement cache - the original cache was at 53d 11.477' N, 6d 04.804' W, hidden under stones where the two walls meet. You can view photos here and here. If you are visiting the replacement, do say hello to the original location!

And so the cache lives again! Enjoy!

Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

Additional Waypoints

PK43 - Parking
N 53° 11.707 W 006° 05.340
Parking
